criteria.name: Step-by-step description
criteria.description: Is there a step-by-step description of the experimental design?

criteria.name: Open Data
criteria.description: Are the raw or processed datasets publicly available (direct link provided or mentioning where it can be found)? If data cannot be shared, is there a clear justification (e.g., privacy concerns)?

criteria.name: Data Documentation
criteria.description: Is there a data dictionary or codebook explaining variables, formats, and preprocessing steps?

criteria.name: Data Collection Methods
criteria.description: Are data collection methods fully described?

criteria.name: Open Source Code
criteria.description: Is the analysis code (Python, R, etc.) shared in a repository (GitHub, GitLab)?

criteria.name: Code for Data preparation
criteria.description: If code is shared: Are scripts for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization included?

criteria.name: Quantitative Research Methods
criteria.description: Are statistical tests, models, and assumptions clearly described? Are effect sizes, confidence intervals, and p-values reported?

criteria.name: Qualitative Research Methods
criteria.description: Is subjective context and interpretation given? Is data coding and analysis cleary described and shared?

criteria.name: Preregistration
criteria.description: Does the Paper contain a link to the preregistration (e.g the Open Science Foundation)? If a paper does not need to use a preregistration (e.g. theoretical or argumentative papers), then this field will be non-applicable

criteria.name: Outcome Shared
criteria.description: Has the outcome of the Experiment been shared?

criteria.name: Limitations and potential biases
criteria.description: Are limitations and potential biases discussed?
